quest.name: Eastern Apprentice
journal: H'naanza has an air of poorly concealed concern.

H'naanza complains that Blanstyr has sent no word of his safe arrival in the Far East. With poorly concealed concern, she asks that you check on the veteran artisan the next time you find yourself in Kugane...for the sake of the guild, of course.

You find Blanstyr standing as if spellbound by the armor on a statue in Kugane, but otherwise safe and sound. Although the shrewd craftsman immediately accuses you of spying for H'naanza, he shows no hesitation in requesting your help with finding a local forge. Head into the artisans' district and catch up with Blanstyr.

Blanstyr approaches the master of Kokajiya and explains how the design of a Heavensturn helmet inspired him to develop his own unique style. Fugetsu mistakes you for another hopeful apprentice, and you find yourself assigned the same crafting task as Blanstyr. Speak with Unryu, and request the materials needed to synthesize a high-quality suit of paladin mail.

Unryu hands over the supplies you need, and reminds you to present your finished work to Fugetsu.

※In the event you lose the ingredients or the synthesis ends in failure, you may try again by speaking with Unryu.

Fugetsu is duly impressed with your finely crafted set of Eorzean-style armor, and promises to commence your lessons once he is finished honoring an important commission. Share your success with Blanstyr.

Blanstyr seems pleased that you have both been accepted as apprentices, and restates his determination to work on developing an individual style. Until Fugetsu is free to begin your instruction, however, it seems you must be content with improving yourself by exploring the properties of the local materials.

※The next armorer quest will be available from Blanstyr upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Synthesize a suit of paladin mail Deliver the suit of paladin mail to Fugetsu.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Blanstyr should have arrived on Far Eastern shores by now, but I've heard not a word from the old aurochs...

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: There was no news of storms or ships lost at sea, so I must assume he made it to Kugane. Have you been there yourself?

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Should you happen to have business on that side of the world, I'd consider it a favor if you could look in on him for me.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Personality aside, Blanstyr is one of our best artisans, and losing him to some mishap would be a terrible blow...for the guild, of course.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Keep an eye out for Blanstyr the next time you're in Kugane, would you? I need to know he's alive and breathing...in my capacity as forgemaster, you understand.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Forename!? Byregot's beard, I thought ye looked familiar! H'naanza sent ye to spy on me, did she?

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: I arrived a while ago, truth be told, but this bloody statue caught me eye an' refused to let go. Just look at the armor on that bloke! Ye don't see naught like that in Eorzea!

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Well, I'd best not stand around gawpin' all day─I need to find a smithy, an' see if they're willin' to teach an old hand like me.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Here, do ye want to come along an' help look, then?

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Good lasslad. The ship's captain told me there's an artisans' district near Pier #1, so let's try there first.

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: May I help you with something?

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Judgin' by the heat an' the noise, I'd say we've come to the right place. Right, well there's naught to be gained by bein' shy.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Beggin' yer pardon, sir, but who might be the master o' this forge? I've traveled here from Eorzea, with a mind to learnin' yer style of armorsmithin'...

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: Well, well. In all my years, never have I had a foreigner seek an apprenticeship at my anvil. Pray tell me more of your aspirations.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: ...Hang on, so yer the master o' this place, then?

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: So the fates have decreed. I am Fugetsu, Kokajiya's humble proprietor and chief armorer.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Oh, I... Pleased to meet ye. The name's Blanstyr. I'm an armorer from Limsa Lominsa, the city where I learned me craft.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: See, I was taken by the strikin' design o' the helms yer countrymen was givin' out on Heavensturn, an' reckoned that I'd like to study with the artisan what crafted 'em. I asked about, an' the answers sent me here, to Kugane...

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: Ah, the Heavensturn helmets. If you seek the man who forged those pieces, then you need look no further. Was there some particular aspect of the design that drew your attention?

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Those were yers, then!? Bugger me, that was easy. ...Ahem. To answer yer question, I've been feelin' that me own work has fallen into a bit of a rut, an' the distinct personality o' them helms is exactly what I've been missin'!

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: The search for one's own style can certainly be a trial. Very well, I should be glad to aid you in finding yours.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Ye will!? Thank ye, sir!

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: Ordinarily I teach but one student at a time, but it will be a refreshing challenge to instruct the two of you together. I look forward to the experience.

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: Before we begin, however, I would gauge your skills as artisans. Would you craft for me a set of quality Eorzean armor?

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: My apprentice, Unryu, will provide you with the necessary materials. Present your work to me when you are finished.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Er, I guess he thought ye was here for the same reason as me. But ye can't pass up this chance, Forename! We can learn the secrets o' Far Eastern armorsmithin' side by side!

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: Is there some confusion regarding your task? I require from you a suit of Eorzean armor that I might evaluate your relative skill. Speak with Unryu, and he shall furnish you with the raw materials you need.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Fugetsu's decided yer here to learn, an' I see no reason to correct him. This could be the chance of a lifetime, Forename─I suggest ye take it!

dialogue.name: UNRYU
dialogue.text: Master Fugetsu explained to me your task. If you would tell me the type of armor you plan to forge, then I shall requisition the appropriate metals from our stores.

dialogue.name: UNRYU
dialogue.text: Ah, a suit of mail, is it? I believe these materials should suffice, but do not hesitate to request more should you find them lacking.

dialogue.name: UNRYU
dialogue.text: Once the armor is complete, you may present it directly to Master Fugetsu. I pray sincerely for your success─a junior apprentice would be most welcome at the forge.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To proceed with the quest, use the materials provided by Unryu to craft a high-quality suit of paladin mail.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should your synthesis efforts prove unsuccessful, speak with Unryu once more to receive another set of materials.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To begin the crafting process, select Logs from the main menu, followed by Crafting Log. Next, select Special Recipes from within the requisite crafting discipline, then Story, and lastly Class Quests to locate the desired recipe.

dialogue.name: UNRYU
dialogue.text: Once the armor is complete, you may present it directly to Master Fugetsu. I pray sincerely for your success─a junior apprentice would be most welcome at the forge.

dialogue.name: UNRYU
dialogue.text: Ah, you seem to be done. As I explained, you may present your work directly to Master Fugetsu. I am but a lowly apprentice.

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: I trust our materials were sufficient for the task?

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: ...A fine piece─you have shown considerable skill in working this amount of detail into such a durable alloy.

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: Though the techniques you employ are not the same as ours, your experience as an artisan is readily apparent. I am curious to see how you will fare with our traditional methods.

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: But whilst I am eager to begin your instruction, I am afraid an important commission must take precedence. Pray use this time to familiarize yourself with the local materials, and I shall inform you when your lessons are to commence.

dialogue.name: FUGETSU
dialogue.text: Kokajiya is in the process of filling a valued commission. I suggest you spend your time learning the peculiarities of our local materials whilst we work to honor our client's request.

dialogue.name: UNRYU
dialogue.text: I am entrusted with overseeing Kokajiya's supply stores. Should you have a particular piece you wish to forge, I will endeavor to meet your needs.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Seems we both managed to impress Master Fugetsu, eh? We've got a foot in the door, but ye know as well as I do that that was the easy part.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: They do things different over here, an' we'll be startin' from the bottom. But if that difference is what brings out the character in me craftin', then it'll be worth the climb to the top...

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Oh, an' don't ye worry none about H'naanza─I'll be sendin' her a letter explainin' what we're up to. Neither one of us wants to hear her gripin' that she thought we was dead or summat!

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Look at us, Forename─seems only yesterday we was rivals, an' now here we are takin' an apprenticeship together. Byregot crafts in mysterious ways, eh?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In apprenticing at a Far Eastern forge, you have learned, “Quality Assurance”!
